properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 3:04PM EST until January 17 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Albany NY
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches with the higher amounts
north of Route 28. Winds gusting as high as 35 to 40 mph. For
the Wind Chill Advisory, dangerous winds chills expected with
values as low as 20 to 25 below zero.

* WHERE...Northern Herkimer and Hamilton Counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 PM this
evening to 7 PM EST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory,
from 3 AM to 10 AM EST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions along with areas of
blowing snow which could significantly reduce visibility. The
cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as
little as 30 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 10 AM EST FRIDAY
